TTutorial Medium

How to change or update version of Node.js

To update your node you will need NVM manager. It's a version manager for node.js.


Install NVM on your machine

For that run the below command.

curl -o- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nvm-sh/nvm/v0.37.2/install.sh | bash

cURL, which stands for client URL is a command-line tool for file transfer with URL syntax. It supports a number of protocols including HTTP, HTTPS, FTP, and many more. HTTP/HTTPS makes it a great candidate for interacting with APIs!

curl can be used on just about any platform on any hardware that exists today. You use curl in a terminal or command prompt, but you need to make sure your system already has it installed. 

Now you have NVM installed on your machine. The second, step is to install the node using it. For that run the below command:

Install node 

nvm install 12.14.1

Replace 12.14.1 with your node version.

If you are getting an error of NVM not recognized then run the below command and then run above again.

source ~/.nvm/nvm.sh

Make the installed version default

Note: Replace 12.14.1 with your installed version.

nvm alias default 12.14.1

And that should update your node version. You can install multiple versions of node using NVM. If you need multiple node versions install them using NVM and make anyone your default version. Whenever you need any specific version just make it your default version using the above command

Check node version

node -v

Once you have updated the version. It should show the updated version like shown in the above image.
